item.title: Rob Pike On Complexity
item.description: “assorted electric cables” by John Carlisle on Unsplash The following is an excerpt from Notes on Programming in C by Rob Pike > Complexity> Most programs are too complicated — that is, more complex than they need to be to solve their problems efficiently. Why? Mostly it’s because of bad design, but I will skip that issue here because it’s a big one. But programs are often complicated at the microscopic level, and that is something I can address here.
